summary: This is an FBI subpoena issued to T-Mobile on October 23, 2019, as part of federal criminal investigation case number 031E-NY-3027571. It demands extensive subscriber records for a specific T-Mobile account (89880537) for the period July 5, 2019, to October 23, 2019, including call records, payment information, and internet connectivity data. The subpoena cites authority related to investigations of federal offenses involving the sexual exploitation or abuse of children.

persons.name: Gavin Pinchback
persons.context: The subpoena is addressed to Gavin Pinchback at T-Mobile's address in Parsippany, NJ, as the point of contact for compliance.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: Signed the subpoena, issuing it under the authority of Public Law No. 106-544.

events.title: Issuance of FBI Subpoena to T-Mobile
events.description: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent issues a subpoena to T-Mobile demanding subscriber records for a specific account as part of a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Compliance Deadline
events.description: The deadline set for T-Mobile to comply with the subpoena by producing records at 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, 23rd Floor, New York, NY 10278-0004
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of federal criminal investigation case number 031E-NY-3027571, which the document indicates relates to an investigation of a 'Federal offense involving the sexual exploitation or abuse of children' as defined by U.S. law.
It demands all subscriber records for T-Mobile account number 89880537 for a specific period (July 5, 2019, to October 23, 2019), including call logs, payment methods, and internet session data.
The subpoena includes a non-disclosure request, asking the company not to reveal its existence indefinitely to avoid interfering with the ongoing investigation.

The legal authority cited is Public Law No. 106-544 (18 U.S.C. ยง3486), which grants the Attorney General and other officials specific subpoena powers for investigations into health care offenses and crimes involving the sexual exploitation of children.
